Issues.Title: Small change to documentation to test PR builds
Issues.Body: Small change to documentation to test PR builds
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Small change to documentation to test PR builds" (#718)

Issues.Title: Add pre-commit Git hook to WPF repo to protect WPF's generated files (installed on first build)
Issues.Body: The WPF for .NET Core source contains a large number of generated files that should only be modified by various custom file generation scripts and tools. This change installs a Git hook (if required) on non-CI builds to protect the generated files.   Attempts to commit generated files will be blocked.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add pre-commit Git hook to WPF repo to protect WPF's generated files (installed on first build)" (#717)

Issues.Title: Button content is not rendered correctly in ItemsControl with FlowDirection=RightToLeft
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`)
3.0.100-preview5-011568
* Windows version: (`winver`)
Version 1809 (OS Build 17763.503)
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes/No
Yes
 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
 Very weird behavior that reproduces only when ItemsControl generates a list of buttons with FlowDirection="RightToLeft"
It seems that if the text ends in ")" (closed paranthesis) then this text is appended at the beginning. 

 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->

`Button text (content)` on the UI it's shown `)Button (content`
Somehow the same is happening if I insert "\" (backslash) before or after.
`Button (content\\\\)` is rendered `\\\\)Button (content`
`Button (content)\\\\` is rendered `)\\\\Button (content` 

If we change the FlowDirection="LeftToRight" then the button content is rendered correctly.

 **Expected behavior:**

The content to be rendered correctly.
 
 **Minimal repro:**
 
Attached a sample in .NET Core Preview 5 that I used to test this.

[SandBoxWpf.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/3203874/SandBoxWpf.zip)

We actually fixed this issue by using HorizontalAlignment="Right" instead of FlowDirection but the behavior did give us quite a challenge. It seems that even in the Live visual tree the content is OK, only it's rendered incorrectly. Perhaps this is undefined behavior or it hides other issues.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Button content is not rendered correctly in ItemsControl with FlowDirection=RightToLeft" (#716)

Issues.Title: RuntimeFrameworkVersion enablement - final step (test projects)
Issues.Body:
This is the final change that brings tests into the fold of building using `RuntimeFrameworkVersion`.

This completes the work that we started at the end of Preview 4 to to use `RuntimeFrameworkVersion` to build the product bits (https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/534, https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/604) in order to improve the coherent-build process for core-sdk. Tests could not be enabled at that time because Arcade SDK lacked the capability to install multiple side-by-side SDK's (an extra version corresponding to `$(MicrosoftNETCoreAppVersion)` (defined in `eng\Versions.props`), needed to run tests since they would build against that version of `Microsoft.NetCore.App`). 

This missing functionality has since been enabled by https://github.com/dotnet/arcade/pull/2343 and https://github.com/dotnet/arcade/pull/2815; along with these, https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/703 helps fix a prerequisite problem. Taken together, we are now able to build the entire repo using `RuntimeFrameworkVersion` against `$(MicrosoftNETCoreAppVersion)` version of `Microsoft.NETCore.App`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "RuntimeFrameworkVersion enablement - final step (test projects)" (#711)

Issues.Title: Define Double as Static Resource - (xmlns:system="clr-namespace:System;assembly=mscorlib" hack)
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`) 3.0 preview 5
* Windows version: (`winver`) 1809
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No

  
 **Problem description:**

xmlns:system="clr-namespace:System;assembly=mscorlib"
not allowed in XAML


 **Actual behavior:** 
 Compiler error

 **Expected behavior:**

 Be able to define
        <system:Double x:Key = "XLargeWidth">200</system:Double>
            <system:Double x:Key = "StartingPointY">-20</system:Double>

for use in styles.

Setter Property="Width" Value="{StaticResource XLargeWidth}" 

 **Minimal repro:**
 Trivial

I guess (hope) I am missing something trivial.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Define Double as Static Resource - (xmlns:system="clr-namespace:System;assembly=mscorlib" hack)" (#708)

Issues.Title: Button renders wrong after mouse leave
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0 preview 5
* Windows version: 1803 build 17134.765
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: ~I don't know.~ It works fine on 4.6/4.7 and 4.8

 **Problem description:**
With this XAML:
```
<Window x:Class="RetailEntertainment.Zorgstand.SignIn.Desktop.Views.AddNewConnectionWindow"
        xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
        xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
        xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/expression/blend/2008"
        xmlns:mc="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/markup-compatibility/2006"
        xmlns:local="clr-namespace:RetailEntertainment.Zorgstand.SignIn.Desktop.Views"
        xmlns:vms="clr-namespace:RetailEntertainment.Zorgstand.SignIn.Desktop.ViewModels"
        mc:Ignorable="d"
        d:DataContext="{d:DesignInstance vms:AddNewRegistrationDialogViewModel}"
        Title="New registration" Width="400" Height="100">
    <StackPanel>
        <TextBlock Text="Entert the connection string received from the portal:" />
        <TextBox Text="{Binding ConnectionString}" />
        <StackPanel Orientation="Horizontal" HorizontalAlignment="Right">
            <Button Content="Cancel" Margin="4" Padding="2" Command="{Binding CloseDialogCommand}"/>
            <Button Content="Save" Margin="4" Padding="2" Command="{Binding TestAndAddRegistrationCommand}"/>
        </StackPanel>
    </StackPanel>
</Window>
```
The buttons render wrong after mouse leaves.
Before:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1906639/57971363-4e266700-798d-11e9-8fb7-61618ae0e269.png)
After:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1906639/57971367-567ea200-798d-11e9-890f-3980dcac4fc0.png)
 
 **Actual behavior:** 
It looks like the button renders as if it has its parent size. 
After resizing the window, it renders normally again.
 
 **Expected behavior:**
No weird rendering
 
 **Minimal repro:**
 Code is above
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Button renders wrong after mouse leave" (#707)

Issues.Title: WPF's Transport packages place RID specific assemblies under incorrect folder
Issues.Body:
WPF's internal transport packages (`Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf.DncEng`) currently place RID specific binaries under `lib\<RID>` folder. 

They should be place under `runtimes\<RID>native\` folder, per spec at [Supporting Multiple .NET Versions](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/create-packages/supporting-multiple-target-frameworks). 

When referencing one of these packages from a test, we notice that the native assemblies are not getting included in `deps.json`, which lead to the identification of this problem. Placing the binaries under the correct location remedies the `deps.json` creation errors.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "WPF's Transport packages place RID specific assemblies under incorrect folder" (#702)

Issues.Title: Fix packaging to place RID specific binaries under runtimes\<rid>\native
Issues.Body:
WPF's internal transport packages currently place RID specific binaries under lib\<RID> folder. 

This change moves them under runtimes\<RID>native\ folder, per spec at [Supporting Multiple .NET Versions](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/create-packages/supporting-multiple-target-frameworks). 

When referencing one of these packages from a test, we noticed that the native assemblies were not getting included in `deps.json`, which lead to the identification of this problem. Placing the binaries under the correct location remedies the `deps.json` creation errors.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix packaging to place RID specific binaries under runtimes\<rid>\native" (#703)

Issues.Title: Change default HorizontalAlignment and VerticalAlignment for set of Controls to Left/Top accordingly
Issues.Body:
Currently all controls have default HorizontalAlignment and VerticalAlignment set to Stretch. For some controls like Grid or Canvas it makes sense, but for Buttons or ComboBoxes it does not.
Here is a list of suggested controls which should have default HorizontalAlignment ="Left" and VerticalAlignment ="Top":
* Button
* Calendar
* CheckBox
* ComboBox
* DatePicker
* Expander
* Label
* Menu - Only Vertical (Top)
* PasswordBox
* ProgressBar
* RadioButton
* Slider
* StatusBar - Only Vertical (Bottom)
* TextBlock
* TextBox
* ToolBar -  Only Vertical (Top)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Change default HorizontalAlignment and VerticalAlignment for set of Controls to Left/Top accordingly" (#699)

Issues.Title: Full temporary folder will crash cursor initialization
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0 Preview5
* Windows version: windows 10 1903
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**

The cursor will crash at initialization when the temporary folder full.
 
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->

I set a cursor from a resource and use this code.

```
var uri = new Uri("pack://application:,,,/Foo.cur");
var resource = Application.GetResourceStream(uri);
Cursor = new Cursor(resource.Stream); 
```

I can find the cursor will crash at initialization when the temporary folder full.

    System.IO.__Error.WinIOError(Int32 errorCode, String maybeFullPath)
    System.IO.Directory.InternalCreateDirectory(String fullPath, String path, Object dirSecurityObj, Boolean checkHost)
    System.IO.Directory.InternalCreateDirectoryHelper(String path, Boolean checkHost)
    System.IO.Directory.CreateDirectory(String path)
    System.IO.FileHelper.CreateAndOpenTemporaryFile(String& filePath, FileAccess fileAccess, FileOptions fileOptions, String extension, String subFolder)
    System.Windows.Input.Cursor.LoadFromStream(Stream cursorStream)
    System.Windows.Input.Cursor..ctor(Stream cursorStream, Boolean scaleWithDpi)
    System.Windows.Input.Cursor..ctor(Stream cursorStream)
    FawlalnejajerelaWhallgemcurkear.MainWindow..ctor()

 **Expected behavior:**
 
The cursor can be set.

 **Minimal repro:**
 
Run this code when the temporary folder full.

            var uri = new Uri("pack://application:,,,/Text.cur");
            var resource = Application.GetResourceStream(uri);
            Cursor = new Cursor(resource.Stream);

And the other way is set a can not visit folder as the temp folder. And you can see the code in https://github.com/lindexi/lindexi_gd/tree/8e346e750fe2075e1366a2a098d63af3b50db177/FawlalnejajerelaWhallgemcurkear that I set a folder name as `D:\lindexi\不存在文件` that is an unauthorized access folder.

**Reason**

The Cursor.LegacyLoadFromStream will generate a temporary file based on the memory stream. But the [Path.GetTempFileName Method](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.io.path.gettempfilename?wt.mc_id=MVP ) limit the number of the files is 65535 and it will throw IOException when overcount.

The LoadFromStream code in https://referencesource.microsoft.com/#PresentationCore/Core/CSharp/System/Windows/Input/Cursor.cs,090cb505b6310a4e

The LegacyLoadFromStream code in https://referencesource.microsoft.com/#PresentationCore/Core/CSharp/System/Windows/Input/Cursor.cs,935d59bd1efe76e4,references

Actual LoadFromStream may ignore LegacyLoadFromStream. But FileHelper.CreateAndOpenTemporaryFile will generate the file in WPF folder by default and use Path.GetRandomFileName to create a file without check access. And it also crashes when the temp folder can not write.

**solution**

1. Set the Environment Variable to the own folder that can read or write. 
            ```
            Environment.SetEnvironmentVariable("TEMP", newTempFolder);
            Environment.SetEnvironmentVariable("TMP", newTempFolder);
            ```
  Why set the environment variable is safe? Because all the process can call the `Path.GetTempFileName` that will throw IOException when the other process uses it to create and do not delete. 
1. Use the `public Cursor(string cursorFile)` replace `public Cursor(Stream cursorStream)` that the first will call LoadFromFile and the LoadFromFile will load the file and do not need to copy to temp folder.


Reference

[WPF 光标初始化的时候 temp 文件夹满了无法创建](https://blog.lindexi.com/post/wpf-%E5%85%89%E6%A0%87%E5%88%9D%E5%A7%8B%E5%8C%96%E7%9A%84%E6%97%B6%E5%80%99-temp-%E6%96%87%E4%BB%B6%E5%A4%B9%E6%BB%A1%E4%BA%86%E6%97%A0%E6%B3%95%E5%88%9B%E5%BB%BA )
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Full temporary folder will crash cursor initialization" (#696)

Issues.Title: Fix DebugType in Release builds
Issues.Body:
We were using DebugType=Full for all build configurations.  This can place undo burden on the JIT for Release builds.  In Release, we still want to emit a PDB, but we want as much optimization as possible so we should use pdbonly.

fixes #693
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix DebugType in Release builds" (#694)

Issues.Title: Incorrect DebugType in Release builds
Issues.Body: We should be setting DebugType to pdbonly in release builds.  Setting it to Full can incur penalties to JIT.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Incorrect DebugType in Release builds" (#693)

Issues.Title: Disable lower version of target framework in wpf netcore project property page.
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`)
* Windows version: RS5
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes/No

.NET Core SDK (reflecting any global.json):
 Version:   3.0.100-preview5-011555
 Commit:    50184f3f6c

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.17763
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x86
 Base Path:   D:\VS\src\Tools\dotnet\sdk\3.0.100-preview5-011555\

Host (useful for support):
  Version: 3.0.0-preview5-27623-11
  Commit:  0090de2841

.NET Core SDKs installed:
  3.0.100-preview5-011555 [D:\VS\src\Tools\dotnet\sdk]

.NET Core runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 3.0.0-preview5-19223-06 [D:\VS\src\Tools\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.0.0-preview5-27623-11 [D:\VS\src\Tools\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 3.0.0-preview5-27623-11 [D:\VS\src\Tools\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]

To install additional .NET Core runtimes or SDKs:
  https://aka.ms/dotnet-download

Steps to repro:
1. Create new WPF netcore project
2. Open project property page, make sure the Target framework is .net core 3.0
3. Open the drop down 

Actual: it includes all the target frameworks, from 1.0 to 3.0
Expected: we should disable all lower versions as they don't support WPF net core project.

If you switch to lower version like 2.1, build will fail.
Severity	Code	Description	Project	File	Line	Suppression State
Error	CS0234	The type or namespace name 'Controls' does not exist in the namespace 'System.Windows' (are you missing an assembly reference?)	WpfApp4	C:\Users\xiwa\source\repos\WpfApp4\WpfApp4\MainWindow.xaml.cs	7	Active​

Error	CS0234	The type or namespace name 'Documents' does not exist in the namespace 'System.Windows' (are you missing an assembly reference?)	WpfApp4	C:\Users\xiwa\source\repos\WpfApp4\WpfApp4\MainWindow.xaml.cs	9	Active​
Error	CS0234	The type or namespace name 'Media' does not exist in the namespace 'System.Windows' (are you missing an assembly reference?)	WpfApp4	C:\Users\xiwa\source\repos\WpfApp4\WpfApp4\MainWindow.xaml.cs	11	Active​
Error	CS0234	The type or namespace name 'Media' does not exist in the namespace 'System.Windows' (are you missing an assembly reference?)	WpfApp4	C:\Users\xiwa\source\repos\WpfApp4\WpfApp4\MainWindow.xaml.cs	12	Active​
Error	CS0234	The type or namespace name 'Navigation' does not exist in the namespace 'System.Windows' (are you missing an assembly reference?)	WpfApp4	C:\Users\xiwa\source\repos\WpfApp4\WpfApp4\MainWindow.xaml.cs	13	Active​
Error	CS0234	The type or namespace name 'Shapes' does not exist in the namespace 'System.Windows' (are you missing an assembly reference?)	WpfApp4	C:\Users\xiwa\source\repos\WpfApp4\WpfApp4\MainWindow.xaml.cs	14	Active​
Error	CS0246	The type or namespace name 'Window' could not be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)	WpfApp4	C:\Users\xiwa\source\repos\WpfApp4\WpfApp4\MainWindow.xaml.cs	21	Active​
Error	CS0103	The name 'InitializeComponent' does not exist in the current context	WpfApp4	C:\Users\xiwa\source\repos\WpfApp4\WpfApp4\MainWindow.xaml.cs	25	Active​

Issues.Title: "Install other frameworks" open new file explorer window
Issues.Body:
Steps:
 Create new wpf netcore project
 Open project property page
 In Target framework dropdown, choose install other frameworks...

I expect something to direct us to the framework install files or download location, but actually got a new file explorer window pointing to Documents
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ""Install other frameworks" open new file explorer window" (#691)

Issues.Title: Enable WPF projects build from Unix
Issues.Body:
It would be quite useful and practical (for example in CI/CD setup with Linux docker images) to be able to cross compile WPF code using `dotnet build` from any of the supported platforms (not only Windows). Currently `dotnet build` on such projects will fail with error, unless executed on Windows.

With this very simple patch (on preview5), compilation goes through (Tested on ubuntu 18.04 LTS)

https://github.com/systemathics/wpf/commit/a9b28ed2998f13ee3c9bce37f405ff820cf43b08 

On our code base, the WPF assemblies produced by building from Linux seem to be almost identical to their counterparts built on Windows. The only difference being in BAML embedded resources, they are not binary identical but when decompiled with ILSPY, their XAML content are.

This issue is there to perhaps consider adding cross compilation of WPF projects and/or referencing unforeseen problems that may happen if we do 

Note: It could also apply to WinForms projects, we managed to build ours correctly with the above patch, but they fail to execute because of unrelated https://github.com/microsoft/msbuild/issues/2221 (Failure occurs also if built from Windows)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Enable WPF projects build from Unix" (#688)
